did.unittitle: Carl Owen Dunbar Archives

repository.corpname: Yale Peabody Museum of Natural History

did.abstract: The archives consist of field notebooks from 1914-1957, photographs of both specimens and localities, inventories of specimens and localities, miscellaneous material gathered for notes and lectures, unpublished manuscripts, and correspondence. There are also hydrographic and topographic maps of Newfoundland, and topographic maps of Illinois, Nebraska, Oklahoma, New York, Texas, Pennsylvania, Arizona, Colorado, and Missouri.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Carl Owen Dunbar Archives, Invertebrate Paleontology, Yale Peabody Museum

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Carl Owen Dunbar (b. 1891, d. 1979) was born in Hallowell, Kansas. His parents, David and Emma (Thomas), lived on a wheat farm in southeastern Kansas. As a youth, he operated the power machinery used to plant and harvest wheat and served as the foreman on the ranch that was established by his grandfather, Warder Dunbar. He attended Cherokee County schools and graduated with honors. He received a B.A. degree from the University of Kansas in 1913 and a Ph.D. in geology from Yale University in 1917, and after a brief stay at the University of Minnesota, he returned to Yale in 1920 where he served with distinction for 39 years.

As a professor, Dunbar was a productive scholar, dedicated teacher and effective administrator. He published more than 200 scientific articles and monographs in invertebrate paleontology (particularly on brachiopods and fusulinids) and stratigraphy. His dedication to undergraduate teaching led him to write 3 textbooks on historical geology, first as a co-author with his mentor Charles Schuchert, and then with Karl Waage, his successor at Yale. Dunbar also wrote 2 textbooks on stratigraphy with Yale professor John Rogers.

During his tenure at Yale Dunbar supervised nearly 25 graduate students, many of whom continued to collaborate with him in the years that followed. As an administrator, Dunbar was also Curator of Invertebrate Paleontology at the Yale Peabody Museum and the Director of the Museum from 1942 until his retirement.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Material
scopecontent.p: Includes Dunbar's personal field notebooks from 1914-1957. Also, maps from his field areas, photographs of specimens and localities, and miscellaneous other material (both biographic and collections related).

Localities.
Photographs & Negatives. Black and white prints and slides of fusulines from Illinois Black and white prints, negatives
Photographs & Negatives. Three black and white prints (7x9, 5x9, 4x2) of YPM 6657, Olenellus getzi. Black and white print.
Photographs & Negatives. Black and white prints of fusulinids from Russia prints
Photographs & Negatives. Black and white glass negatives of Pennsylvanian fusulines from Nebraska
Photographs & Negatives. Black and white glass negatives of Pennsylvania fusulines from Nebraska
Photographs & Negatives. Black and white prints and negatives of Pennsylvanian fusulinids from New Mexico, Colorado, Nevada and China Black and white prints
Photographs & Negatives. Glass negatives of fusulinids from India, Pennsylvanian, Permian
Photographs & Negatives. Glass negatives a n prints of fusulinids, Salt Range, India, Pennsylvanian, Permian
Slides. 35 mm black & white, & color slides; Permian, Glass Mtns area, Texas; New York; Tennessee; Virginia; England; Russia: fusulinids. 35 mm slides, b & w, & color. 1940-1960
Specimens.
Negatives and photographs. Black and white negatives and prints of nautiloids from the Ordovician of Newfoundland.
Miscellaneous
Collection Information. Collection lists, notes and inventories.
Faunal list. Faunal list: New York.
Papers, notes, correspondence. Correspondence, memo's and notes of a committee or program to evaluate the potential of Arctic research for the Arctic Institute of North America
Inventory of Fred Braun Collection after arrival at Yale.
Notes on collections by Danish expeditions: Greenland.
Notes on YPM fusulinid collection; YPM types
Notes on YPM fusulinid collection with locality descr.
Catalog of Undergraduate Teaching Collection - Nautiloidea, Ammonoidea, Gastropoda, Bivalvia, Trilobita, Ostracoda, Bryozoa (formerly doc. 155); (+ dissociated specimen labels. see also doc. 362).
Correspondence.
Papers, notes, correspondence. Correspondence, memos and notes pertaining to the "Pseudoschwagerina stanislavi" problem. 1944-1953.
Papers, notes, correspondence. Correspondence, memos and notes pertaining to Walcott medal for 1962 which was presented to A.A. Opik. 1961-1962
Locality Information. Miscellaneous locality catalogs.
Catalog of localities. Catalog of localities: Alabama, Florida.
Catalog of localities. Catalog of L. Koch's Permian localities: Greenland.
Guidebook. Field Guidebook & Catalog of Tertiary type localities: Alabama, Mississippi.
Locality information. locality information; Georgia.
Locality information. Catalog of W. Maync's Permian localities: Greenland.

List of Pennsylvanian fusulinids YPM 11001 - 11274 with horizon, loc., and coll., from Illinois, Texas, Nebraska, Oklahoma, Missouri, Iowa, Nevada, Bolivia, from many different accns (probably related to paper by Dunbar on fusulinids of Nebraska). 1928 +/-5
List of Goniatite Zones, England.
Miscellaneous. Miscellaneous archives including unpublished work, memorabilia, guidebooks, and other material.
Manuscript material. Unpublished MS by Dunbar on "Exothecal tissue in the Archeocyathidae": & black ane white negatives and prints of YPM 17047 (Exocyathus regularis)
Miscellaneous. Memorabilia; including transcript of taped interview done by K.M. Waage, certificates, newspaper articles, photographs, etc.

Miscellaneous. C. O. Dunbar's personal "encyclopedia" consisting of index card notes. Notes cover published references to many taxonomic groups, stratigraphic periods, and geographic regions, as well as some newspaper and article clippings. This collection is also referred to as "WikiDunbar" and "Dunbarpedia." 19 envelopes.
Miscellaneous. 2 boxes of black and white lantern slides - "Permian faunas." These include figures, photos, and fossil plates. (14 slides in total).
Copies of excursion guidebooks for the 17th International Geological Congress, Russia.
Class notes (4 notebooks) by C.V.A. [Catherine (Bobby) Van Aken (Smith)], Invertebrate Paleontology & Invertebrate Zoology. 1947-1949
removed to IPAR.000328
List of the distribution of Flexibilia Crinoids by genus.
